intro: Microparacaryum intermedium f. paracaryoides, commonly known as the small paracaryum, is a rare aquatic plant belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, spirally arranged leaves. The plant typically grows in shallow, still freshwater habitats such as ponds and slow-moving streams. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, often emerging from the water surface. It is valued in botanical gardens for its unique morphology and ecological significance.
